text: I have a connection problem between my HubSpot developer account and my MAKE account (ex integromat). When I try to connect the two tools together I get this error message. I already managed to connect the two tools but for some time it doesn't work
Can some one help me with this?

Hi everyone, we want to map the management of the newsletter subscription status (opt-in/opt-out) in our system and then set the status via API for the contact in HubSpot. Our developers are currently evaluating the API and have come across the following sentence:
 “The subscribe contact endpoint allows you to subscribe an email address to any given subscription type in an account, but will *not allow you to resubscribe contacts who have opted out.*” (Siehe <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing-api/subscriptions-preferences>)
Is it right that if a customer opts out of a list in our system and we set the subscription type to opt-out on the HS side via API, that a re-subscribe via our system that sets the re-subscribe via API on the HS side for the contact and subscription type is not possible? If so, is someone aware of possible alternative approaches?
Thanks a lot for your help in advance!

Hello!
Is it possible to restore the old HubSpot API key after it was updated by mistake to new one?
Thanks in advance!
This is correct. See this thread: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C26E7JT8V/p1647524425431829|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C26E7JT8V/p1647524425431829>
I don’t think so

ok, ian.
Have some feedback for you on this endpoint.
The email sender is set by the `HubSpot_owner_id`
The read only fields will be populated based on this value
after you create the engagement, you will then associate it to the record which will then set the email to information
docs are not very clear and the example on the endpoint is misleading.  I am working with the team to update this for better clarity
Thanks! I also heard back on my support ticket - the gist of that was basically to use the v1 endpoint for now, I think.
v3 should be fine if you strip away those read only props
Well, the "sender" I'm logging is not the owner.
Unless an owner can be a contact?
It has to be a user, right?
Besides, I've already implemented everything in v1.
yeah.  would have to be user and not a contact
DISREGARD ME :wink:
(might be worth creating an idea for this, though)
:slightly_smiling_face:

Does anyone know if it is possible to have an API token with permission for a specific List. So you can push a Profile into a list but not necessarily manipulate other lists. Our use case is a 3rd party marketing partner wanting to push contacts into our HubSpot, but we don't want them able to access existing data in HubSpot
Hi everyone! Is anyone working in HubSpot Python APIs repo? Is this something that can be solved locally? <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python/issues/95>

my app is requesting a set of scopes and i get the following error when i try to connect my live HubSpot instance: “_This hub doesn’t have access to some HubSpot features that are required by this integration. Please contact the integrator.”_
how can i tell which features are in conflict here?
You cant, but you can set most scopes as optional and then check what you wanted vs what you actually got and that way you will find what was missing.
